page.title: 08The Southdown Fair - 2
page.content: {(Cont. from Page 7)} As noted on Page 7{Robert}is the manager of the Fair. Twin brother{John is responsible for all the painting of the lorries and rides.{Ted}and{Douglas do the driving and{Fred}does the welding and engineering. To supplement the summer earnings from the Fair the brothers work as tree fellers in the winter months while the equipment is either stored or repaired. It takes a whole day to get the Fair 'on the road', which is every weekend from May to September. They have a set pattern of visits, being booked a year in advance; advertising is therefore unnecssary. The furthest towns they visit are Sellinge, Kent in the east and Southampton to the west. With three sons{Lee, Tim}and{Dan}it is{Robert's}hope that the Fair will continue for many years to come. {
